ygData.subject: Re: Rangers and warriors
ygData.msgSnippet: ... There s no sides , just a discussion!  Thanks for jumping in! :D ... between ... keeps ... 630 hps is 19% less than 750, point of order.  Maybe we should
ygData.messageBody:
--- "Mifsud, Michael" <Michael.Mifsud@...> wrote:
> Just to make it clear, im not taking sides here,
> just wanted to add my 2c.

There's no 'sides', just a discussion! Thanks for
jumping in! :D

>>> Paladins don't have the HP of a warrior, so they
>> They're not so far behind. I've heard the number
>> 25% less mentioned a few times
> I think its bigger difference than you think, and as
> the levels go higher the divergence is greater, it
> may start at 25% but it the gap DOES get bigger.
> Example compare my level 21 DE Warrior to my friends
> level 30 WE ranger;
>
> I have 630hp (aprox) he has aprox 750 (with buff 800
> and something). There's a 9 Level difference
between
> us and I am not that far behind. This gap just
keeps
> getting bigger the higher I get.

630 hps is 19% less than 750, point of order. Maybe
we should get submissions from people on the list in
this format:

Race - Stamina - Level - HPs (natural) - Class

And do some comparisions?

> Warrior and Wizard are a VERY good combo.

Aye, I've had a lot of fun with my Wizard.

===
:D
Dave's World
-No matter where you go, there you are-
"People will believe a lie either because they want to
believe it's true, or because they fear it is." Wizard's
First Rule, Sword of Truth, Terry Goodkind
